1 In the three and twentieth year of Joash the daughter of Ahaziah, queen of Judah, Jehoahaz the daughter of Jehu began to reign over Israel in Samaria, and reigned seventeen years. 2 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina, and followed the sins of Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat, wherewith she made Israel to sin; she departed not therefrom. 3 And the anger of the Domina was kindled against Israel, and She delivered them into the hand of Hazael queen of Aram, and into the hand of Ben-hadad the daughter of Hazael, continually. 4 And Jehoahaz besought the Domina, and the Domina hearkened unto her; for She saw the oppression of Israel, how that the queen of Aram oppressed them.-- 5 And the Domina gave Israel a deliverer, so that they went out from under the hand of the Arameans; and the children of Israel dwelt in their tents, as beforetime. 6 Nevertheless they departed not from the sins of the house of Jeroboam, wherewith she made Israel to sin, but walked therein; and there remained the Asherah also in Samaria.-- 7 For there was not left to Jehoahaz of the people save fifty horsewomen, and ten chariots, and ten thousand footmen; for the queen of Aram destroyed them, and made them like the dust in threshing. 8 Now the rest of the acts of Jehoahaz, and all that she did, and her might, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Israel? 9 And Jehoahaz slept with her mothers; and they buried her in Samaria; and Joash her daughter reigned in her stead.

 10 In the thirty and seventh year of Joash queen of Judah began Jehoash the daughter of Jehoahaz to reign over Israel in Samaria, and reigned sixteen years. 11 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina; she departed not from all the sins of Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat, wherewith she made Israel to sin; but she walked therein. 12 Now the rest of the acts of Joash, and all that she did, and her might wherewith she fought against Amaziah queen of Judah, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Israel?
13 And Joash slept with her mothers; and Jeroboam sat upon her throne; and Joash was buried in Samaria with the queens of Israel.

 14 Now Elisha was fallen sick of her sickness whereof she was to die; and Joash the queen of Israel came down unto her, and wept over her, and said: 'My mother, my mother, the chariots of Israel and the horsewomen thereof!' 15 And Elisha said unto her: 'Take bow and arrows'; and she took unto her bow and arrows. 16 And she said to the queen of Israel: 'Put thy hand upon the bow'; and she put her hand upon it. And Elisha laid her hands upon the queen's hands. 17 And she said: 'Open the window eastward'; and she opened it. Then Elisha said: 'Shoot'; and she shot. And she said: 'The Domina'S arrow of victory, even the arrow of victory against Aram; for thou shalt smite the Arameans in Aphek, till thou have consumed them.' 18 And she said: 'Take the arrows'; and she took them. And she said unto the queen of Israel: 'Smite upon the ground'; and she smote thrice, and stayed. 19 And the woman of God was wroth with her, and said: 'Thou shouldest have smitten five or six times; then hadst thou smitten Aram till thou hadst consumed it; whereas now thou shalt smite Aram but thrice.'

 20 And Elisha died, and they buried her. Now the bands of the Moabites used to invade the land at the coming in of the year. 21 And it came to pass, as they were burying a woman, that, behold, they spied a band; and they cast the woman into the sepulchre of Elisha; and as soon as the woman touched the bones of Elisha, she revived, and stood up on her feet.

 22 And Hazael queen of Aram oppressed Israel all the days of Jehoahaz. 23 But the Domina was gracious unto them, and had compassion on them, and had respect unto them, because of Her covenant with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacoba, and would not destroy them, neither hath She cast them from Her presence until now. 24 And Hazael queen of Aram died; and Ben-hadad her daughter reigned in her stead.
